eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
It allows objects to move:
- on an ellipsis or arcs
- smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)

It can be used for:
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Moving platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: EllipseMovement

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ObjectSpawner
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Can be used to create enemies, NPCs, environmental objects, etc.

How to use:
- Add this behavior to an object
- Place spawners on the scene 
- Run the "Spawn objects" action on every frame
- Control spawning by adjusting behavior properties

Properties:
Spawn period:  Number of seconds before spawning another object.
Max quantity:  Each spawner will try to maintain this number of spawned objects
Offset X/Y:  Use to adjust where the object are spawned, relative to the origin of the spawner

Tips:
- Use "Object was just spawned" condition to trigger visual and sound effects (if desired)
- Set max quantity to "0" to never stop spawning objects
- Spawned objects are automatically linked to the spawner
- Note:  If max quantity has been reached and an instance is deleted, the spawner will wait the duration of spawn period before creating another instance.

eventsFunctions.description: Spawn (create) objects periodically.
eventsFunctions.name: SpawnObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Periodically spawn (create) a _PARAM2_ located at spawner _PARAM0_

events.comment: Always spawn objects if quantity is set to "0"
Check if max number of instances per spawner has been reached
This is used so that objects are not immediately spawned after deleting an instance after max instances had been reached
Check if max number of instances per spawner has been reached
Reset spawn detection
Spawn an object when conditions are met
Note: Spawned objects are linked to the spawner to check their number per spawner

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: add_, @Jurfix
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ExtendedMath
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Additional math functions and constants as expressions and conditions.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Expressions:
 - Mathematical constants
 - Greatest common factor/Lowest common multiple
 - Factorial
 - Coordinates conversion for polar and isometric systems
 - ToFixedString: Formats a number into a string with the specified number of decimal places
 - ToFixed: (Deprecated) Formats a number to use the specified number of decimal places

Conditions:
- IsEven: Check if the number is even (divisible by 2)

Release Notes:

Version 1.0.7
- Added ToFixedString()
- Deprecated ToFixed() because it does not show any trailing zeros for whole numbers. Prefer using ToFixedString() to set values in text objects.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SmoothCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_camcoder_gopro_go_pro_camera.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
The camera follows an object according to:
- a frame rate independent catch-up speed to make the scrolling from smooth to strong
- a maximum speed to do linear following or slow down the camera when teleporting the object
- a follow-free zone to avoid scrolling on small movements
- an offset to see further in one direction
- an extra delay and catch-up speed to give an impression of speed (useful for dash)
- position forecasting and delay to simulate a cameraman response time

A platformer dedicated behavior allows to switch of settings when the character is in air or on the floor. This can be used to stabilize the camera when jumping.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SmoothCamera

events.comment: Update private properties through setters to check their values and initialize state.

Delaying and forecasting can be used at the same time.
Forecasting only use the positions that are older than the one used for delaying.
The behavior uses a position history that is split in 2 arrays:
- one for delaying the position (from TimeFromStart to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay)
- one for forecasting the position (from TimeFromStart - CamearDelay to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay - ForecastHistoryDuration

At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * speed

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * speed

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * speed^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln(speed))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

eventsFunctions.description: Delay the camera according to a maximum speed and catch up the delay.
eventsFunctions.name: WaitAndCatchUp
eventsFunctions.sentence: Delay the camera of _PARAM0_ during: _PARAM2_ seconds according to the maximum speed _PARAM3_;_PARAM4_ seconds and catch up in _PARAM5_ seconds

events.comment: Maybe the catch-up show be done in constant pixel speed instead of constant time speed.

Use the object center when no delay is asked.
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful for delaying and pass it to the history for forecasting.
Don't move the camera if there is not enough history.

Add the extra delay that could be needed to respect the speed limit in waiting mode.

speedRatio = min(speedMaxX / historySpeedX, speedMaxY / historySpeedY)
delay += min(0, timeDelta * (1 - speedRatio))
The time with delay is now between the first 2 indexes

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the camera following target is delayed from the object.
eventsFunctions.name: IsDelayed

eventsFunctions.description: Return the current camera delay.
eventsFunctions.name: CurrentDelay

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the camera following is waiting at a reduced speed.
eventsFunctions.name: IsWaiting

eventsFunctions.description: Add a position to the history for forecasting. This is called 2 times in UpadteDelayedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: AddForecastHistoryPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Add the time:_PARAM2_ and position: _PARAM3_; _PARAM4_ to the forecast history of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful.
Keep at least 2 positions because no forecast can be done with less positions.

eventsFunctions.description: Update forecasted position. This is called in doStepPreEvents.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateForecastedPosition

events.comment:
Simple linear regression
y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX

Note than we could use only one position every N positions to reduce the process time,
but if we really need efficient process JavaScript and circular queues are a must.

VarianceX = sum((X[i] - MeanX)²)
VarianceY = sum((Y[i] - MeanY)²)
Covariance = sum((X[i] - MeanX) * (Y[i] - MeanY))

y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX
Axis permutation to avoid a ratio between 2 numbers near 0.
Permute back axis

eventsFunctions.description: Project history ends position to have the vector on the line from linear regression. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ProjectHistoryEnds
eventsFunctions.sentence: Project history oldest: _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ and newest position: _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Perpendicular line:
pA = -1/a; 
pB = -pA * x + y

Intersection:
/ ProjectedY = a * ProjectedX + b
\ ProjectedY = pA * ProjectedX + b

Solution that is cleaned out from indeterminism (like 0 / 0 or infinity / infinity):
ProjectedX= (x + (y - b) * a) / (a² + 1)
ProjectedY = y + (x * a - y + b) / (a² + 1)

eventsFunctions.description: Return the ratio between forecast time and the duration of the history. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ForecastTimeRatio

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ExtendedVariables
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add conditions, actions and expressions to check for the existence of a variable, copy variables, delete existing ones from memory, and create dynamic variables.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension provides: 
- Conditions to check if a global/scene/object variable exists.
- Actions to copy object variables, global and scene variables.
- Actions to delete an existing global/scene variable from memory.
- Actions to create a global/scene variable using a text expression, rather than a variable name input.
- Expressions to get the value or text from a global/scene variable using a text expression, rather than a variable name.

Text expressions allows to enter the name of the variable with an expression like `"MyVar"+ ToString(Variable(Health))`

eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = globalVariables.has(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("GlobalVariableName"));

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy31, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake the camera on the specified layer using one or more methods of shaking (position, angle, zoom).
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Ideal for explosions, hit/impacts, earthquake, etc.

Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position:  Shake the X and/or Y position of the camera 
- Angle: Shake the rotation of the camera 
- Zoom: Shake the zoom level of the camera 

Control how the camera shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the camera moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the camera
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each change of the movement of the camera
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)

Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers 
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Camera is not shaking" 
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters. 
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing

eventsFunctions.description: Shake the camera on the specified layer, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, zoom).
eventsFunctions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake camera on _PARAM3_ layer for _PARAM5_ seconds. Use an amplitude of _PARAM1_px on X axis and _PARAM2_px on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM6_ degrees, and zoom amplitude _PARAM7_ percent.  Wait _PARAM8_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM9_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the X axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the Y axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

events.comment: Keep shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
DisplacementAngle = ((DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration) * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate clockwise (this includes the initial shake and can be used for a one shake effect)
DisplacementAngle = -1 * ((DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration) * Amplitude
Calculate Zoom shake
Calculate camera zoom displacement, with linear decay over time
ZoomDisplacement = ((DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration) * Amplitude *  1/100
Every even shake, increase zoom
Every "odd" shake, decrease scale
ZoomDisplacement = -1 * ((DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration) * Amplitude *  1/100
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change zoom
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Change angle
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Change zoom
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached or if stop shaking has been requested

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables

eventsFunctions.description: Check if camera is shaking.
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Stop shaking the camera.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health points and damage, including a protective shield and armor.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Manage health points including a protective shield and armor. Health can be assigned to players, enemies, NPCs, or even inanimate objects such as breaking doors and mining rocks.

Damage calculations are performed in this order:

Incoming Damage -> Is Damage Cooldown active? -> Chance to Dodge -> Flat Damage Reduction -> Percent Damage Reduction -> Damage to Shield -> Damage to Health

How to use:

- Set desired values in behavior properties
- To apply damage use “Apply damage to an object”
- To heal health, use “Heal object” action
- To activate the shield, use “Activate shield” action
- Health and shield regeneration will happen automatically based on properties
 
Tips:

- While damage cooldown is active, no damage will be applied to health or shield (the object is invincible)
- Try using the “Blink” extension while damage cooldown is active
- Use the “Is just damaged” or "Is just healed" conditions to trigger sound and visual effects

Health properties:

- Starting health points
- Maximum health points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Damage cooldown (seconds) Use "0" for no cooldown
- Rate of health regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before health regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)

Shield properties:

- Max shield points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Duration of shield (seconds) Use "0" to make shield permanent
- Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Block excess damage when shield is broken (yes/no)

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points including a protective shield and armor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxShield
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the maximum shield of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: Change current shield points. Will not trigger damage cooldown.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldPoints
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change current shield points on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: Change rate of shield regeneration.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldRegenRate
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the shield regeneration rate of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points per second

eventsFunctions.description: Change delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldRegenDelay
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the shield regeneration delay on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: Change duration of shield. Use "0" to make shield permanent.
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldDuration
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the duration of shield on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: Renew shield duration to it's full value.
eventsFunctions.name: RenewShieldDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Activate the shield by setting the shield points and renewing the shield duration (optional).
eventsFunctions.name: ActivateShield
eventsFunctions.sentence: Activate the shield on _PARAM0_ with _PARAM2_ points (Renew shield duration: _PARAM3_)

eventsFunctions.description: Change maximum shield points.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxShieldPoints
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the maximum shield points on _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ points

eventsFunctions.description: Enable (or disable) blocking excess damage when shield breaks.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Block excess damage when shield breaks
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldBlockExcessDamage
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shield on _PARAM0_ blocks excess damage when it breaks: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the shield was just damaged previously in the events.
eventsFunctions.name: IsShieldJustDamaged
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shield on _PARAM0_ has just been damaged

eventsFunctions.description: Check if incoming damage was just dodged.
eventsFunctions.name: IsJustDodged

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the shield is active (based on shield points and duration).
eventsFunctions.name: IsShieldActive

events.comment: To be considered "active", a shield must have positive points AND not exceed duration
Don't check the timer when duration is zero (or negative)

eventsFunctions.name: ShieldTimeRemaining

propertyDescriptors.label: Starting health (life) points

propertyDescriptors.label: Delay before health regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
propertyDescriptors.name: HealthRegenDelay

propertyDescriptors.label: Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)
propertyDescriptors.name: AllowOverHealing

propertyDescriptors.label: Current shield points
propertyDescriptors.name: CurrentShieldPoints

propertyDescriptors.label: Maximum shield (points) Use "0" for no maximum

propertyDescriptors.label: Duration of shield (seconds) Use "0" to make shield permanent

propertyDescriptors.label: Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldRegenRate

propertyDescriptors.label: Block excess damage when shield is broken
propertyDescriptors.name: BlockExcessDamage

propertyDescriptors.label: Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
propertyDescriptors.name: ShieldRegenDelay

propertyDescriptors.label: Chance to dodge incoming damage (Range: 0 to 1) If damage is dodged, no damage is applied
propertyDescriptors.name: ChanceToDodge

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage to health from the previous incoming damage
propertyDescriptors.name: DamageToBeApplied

propertyDescriptors.label: Flat damage reduction from armor (incoming damage is reduced by this value)

propertyDescriptors.name: PercentDamageReduction
